title: Grow macroalgae
text: package intends formalise disseminate macroalgae growth model originally developed Hadley et al. (2015) modified subsequent works.

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: Macroalgae height

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include parameters: h_max, maximum species height. Can NA. h_max supplied algae height = h_max h_a, h_b h_c, parameters governing height change N_f

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: scalar macroalgae height (m)

title: Macroalgae height — algae_height
text: Calculates macroalgae height \(h_m = \left(\frac{N_f}{h_a}\right)^{h_b} + h_c\) maximum h_{max}. #' Defaults \(h_a=1000\), \(h_b=1\) \(h_c=0\). Algae height therefore defaults \(N_f \times 10^{-3}\) parameters supplied.

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
text: Total drag coefficient

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
code: C_t(   u_c,   u_b,   macro_state = c(biomass, hm),   SA_WW = 0.5 * (0.0306/2),   site_params,   constants = c(s = 0.0045, gam = 1.13, a2 = 0.2^2, Cb = 0.0025) )

title: Total drag coefficient — C_t
text: macro_state vector named numbers. Must include: biomass, macroalgae wet weight (g) hm, algae height (m) SA_WW conversion wet weight surface area (default 0.5\(\times\)0.5\(\times\)0.0306, based Macrocystis pyrifera) site_params vector named numbers. Must include: hz, total water depth (m) hc, vertical water column occupied canopy (m) d_top, depth top canopy beneath water surface (m) constants vector named numbers defining extra constants attenuation submodel. Must include: s = 0.0045 gam = 1.13 a2 = 0.2^2 Cb = 0.0025

text: Get correct uptake rate

title: Get the correct uptake rate — get_uptake
Get the correct uptake rate — get_uptake
text: conc substrate concentration uptake_shape kinetic shape substrate uptake. One "linear" "Michaelis-Menton" ("MM"). Defaults Michaelis-Menton. Nform_abbr abbreviation used spec_params relevant nitrogen form. See details. spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: M C linear uptake, V K Michaelis-Menton uptake uptake_shape "linear" "MM" ("Michaelis-Menton"). required one set parameters provided.

title: Get the correct uptake rate — get_uptake
text: Gives substrate uptake rate based shape species-specific parameters supplied. shape supplied, attempts infer correct shape supplied parameters. Nform_abbr allows function link species parameters concentration. E.g. Nform_abbr = "amm" (ammonium) function look M_amm C_amm V_amm K_amm spec_params ignore uptake parameters may included substrates.

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: Initiate grow macroalgae.

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
code: grow_macroalgae(   start,   grow_days,   temperature,   light,   velocity,   nitrate,   ammonium,   other_N,   ni_uptake,   am_uptake,   site_params,   spec_params,   initials,   other_constants = c(s = 0.0045, gam = 1.13, a2 = 0.2^2, Cb = 0.0025) )

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: start date, start growth period, date -sea deployment grow_days integer, number day growing period - missing take length temperature vector temperature vector daily temperatures (C) light vector incoming light (umol m-2 s-1) velocity vector water velocities (m s-1) nitrate vector nitrate concentrations (mg m-3) ammonium vector ammonium concentrations (mg m-3) other_N vector nitrogen concentrations (mg N m-3) site_params named vector species-specific parameters - see details spec_params named vector site-specific parameters - see details initials named vector macroalgae starting conditions other_constants named vector miscellaneous constants, including: s = 0.0045, experimentally-derived shape factor macroalgae movement water gam = 1.13, modified drag coefficient macroalgae a2 = 0.2^2, Cb = 0.0025, bottom friction coefficient

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: dataframe outputs

title: Grow macroalgae — grow_macroalgae
text: Example csv spec_params & site_params required? Note final growth dataframe inclusive start end date, environmental vectors must

title: Light limitation on growth — I_lim
text: Calculates relative limitation growth rate due light availability, via: $$I_{lim} = \frac{e}{K \cdot d_{top}} \times \Biggl[e^{-\frac{I_z e^{-K \cdot d_{top}}}{I_o}} - e^{-\frac{I_z}{I_o}} \Biggr]$$ \(I_{z}=e^{-k_W \cdot d_{top}}\) irradiance cultivation depth \(K=k_{m}+kW\) total attenuation coefficient. \(k_{m}\) additional attenuation coefficient macroalgae biomass, calculated : $$k_{m} = a_{cs} \times N_f \times \text{max} \Biggl( \frac{h_{m}}{d_{top}}, 1 \Biggr) \times \frac{1}{\text{min}(h_{m}, d_{top})}$$ \(h_m\) macroalgae height.

title: Light limitation on growth — I_lim
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) surface irradiance, PAR (\(\mu\)mol photons m\(^{-2}\) s\(^{-1}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: a_cs, carbon-specific self-shading constant I_o, light saturation parameter h_a, h_b h_c, parameters governing height change N_f h_max, maximum species height site_params vector named numbers. Must include: \(d_{top}\) -surface  depth (m) top macroalgae culture \(kW\) light-attenuation coefficient open water

title: Light limitation on growth — I_lim
text: scalar relative light limitation growth (0 1)

what: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi
title: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi
text: Calculates light attenuation coefficient water via: $$\begin{array}[ccc] K_d(PAR) &=& 1.584 × SDD^{-0.894} \end{array}$$ SDD Secchi disk depth. Equation adapted Zhang, Y., Liu, X., Yin, Y., Wang, M., & Qin, B. (2012). Predicting light attenuation coefficient Secchi disk depth beam attenuation coefficient large, shallow, freshwater lake. Hydrobiologia, 693(1), 29–37. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10750-012-1084-2.

title: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi
Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi
text: SDD Secchi disk depth (m)

title: Kd parameter from Secchi disk depth — Kd_from_Secchi

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: macroalgae fragmentation rate (\(D\)) calculated : $$D = D_{ve} \times U_0 + D_{tu} + D_{m}$$ \(D_{ve}\) linear coefficient loss laminar velocity (\(U_0\)), \(D_{tu}\) loss rate specified level turbulence (static, low, medium, high), \(D_{m}\) base loss rate.

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: U0 incoming incident water velocity (m/s) turbulence optional level turbulence. Options "none"/"static", "low", "medium"/"mid", "high". spec_params vector named numbers. default 0 supplied. Can include: D_m, constant (base) loss rate D_ve, linear coefficient loss laminar velocity D_st, loss rate static water (turbulence = 0, "none" "static") D_lo, loss rate turbulent water (turbulence = 1 "low") D_mi, loss rate turbulent water (turbulence = 2 "medium") D_hi, loss rate turbulent water (turbulence = 3 "high")

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: scalar macroalgae loss (d-1)

title: Loss through fragmentation — loss
text: Note parameter U0 default. one supplied, loss due velocity default 0 regardless value D_ve supplied.

Non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient — Q_int
text: Calculates internal nutrient quotient \(Q\) via: $$\begin{array}[ccc] Q &=& Q_{min} \left(1 + \frac{N_s}{N_f}\right) \end{array}$$

title: Non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient — Q_int
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) Ns Stored nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: Q_min, minimum internal nutrient quotient

title: Non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient — Q_int
text: non-dimensionalised internal nutrient quotient

title: Q_int limitation on growth — Q_lim
text: Calculates internal nutrient quotient \(Q_{int}\) relative effect growth rate \(Q_{lim}\) via: $$\begin{array}[ccc] Q_{int} &=& Q_{min} \left(1 + \frac{N_s}{N_f}\right) \\ Q_{lim} &=& \frac{Q_{int} - Q_{min}}{Q_{int} - K_c} \end{array}$$

title: Q_int limitation on growth — Q_lim
text: Nf Fixed nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) Ns Stored nitrogen (mg m\(^{-3}\)) spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: Q_min, minimum nutrient quotient Q_max, maximum nutrient quotient K_c, half-saturation growth constant

title: Q_int limitation on growth — Q_lim
text: scalar relative limitation internal nutrient reserves growth (0 1)

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: Solar Radiation PPFD

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: solarMJ MJ per day

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: PPFD umol m-2 s-1

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: following function documentation copied verbatim file modules/data.atmosphere/R/metutils.R https://github.com/PecanProject/pecan/. easy straight way convert MJ/m2 mu mol photons / m2 / s (PAR). Note: 1 Watt = 1J/s conversion based following reasoning 0.12 much total radiation expected ocurr hour maximum insolation (guesstimate) 2.07 coefficient converts MJ mol photons (approximate taken ... Campbell Norman (1998). Introduction Environmental Biophysics. pg 151 'energy content solar radiation PAR waveband 2.35 x 10^5 J/mol' See also chapter radiation basics (10) input total solar radiation obtain PAR spectrum need multiply 0.486 last value 0.486 based approximation PAR 0.45-0.50 total radiation means 1e6 / (2.35e6) * 0.486 = 2.07 1e6 converts mol mu mol 1/3600 divides values hours seconds

title: MJ to PPFD — solarMJ2ppfd
text: Fernando Miguez David LeBauer

title: Temperature limitation on growth — T_lim
text: Given species parameters, returns relative limitation growth rate according CTMI curve: $$\begin{array}[ccc]      T_{lim} &=& \frac{(T_c-T_{max})(T_c-T_{min})^2}{(T_{opt}-T_{min})[(T_{opt}-T_{min})(T_c-T_{opt})-(T_{opt}-T_{max})(T_{opt}+T_{min}-2T_c)]} \end{array}$$

title: Temperature limitation on growth — T_lim
text: Tc temperature evaluate spec_params vector named numbers. Must include: T_opt optimum temperature macroalgae growth T_min minimum temperature macroalgae growth (T_c < T_min, growth = 0) T_max maximum temperature macroalgae growth (T_c > T_max, growth = 0)

title: Temperature limitation on growth — T_lim
text: scalar relative temperature limitation growth (0 1)
